snippet: “These Seven Sicknesses,” a condensed adaptation of Sophocles’ seven surviving plays, is being performed at the Flea Theater by its resident acting company, the Bats.
abstract: Catherine Rampell reviews Flea Theater production of Sophocles play These Seven Sicknesses, adapted by Sean Graney, directed by Ed Sylvanus Iskandar and featuring performances by acting company the Bats.
lead_paragraph: “These Seven Sicknesses,” a condensed adaptation of Sophocles’ seven surviving plays, is being performed at the Flea Theater by its resident acting company, the Bats.

headline.seo: Adapting Sophocles: ‘These Seven Sicknesses’ at Flea Theater
headline.main: Sophocles’ Tragic Tales as a Blood-Soaked Tapestry
headline.print_headline: Sophocles’ Tragic Tales As a Blood-Soaked Tapestry
